alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 4:35AM PST until December 26 at 6:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING ABOVE 5000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Wet snow occurring above 5000 feet. Heavy wet snow possible on Monday and Monday night. Plan on slippery road conditions. Damage to trees and power lines is possible. Above 5000 feet, additional wet snow accumulations of up to one inch are expected early this morning. Total wet snow accumulations of up to 3 inches on Monday afternoon and night, with localized amounts up to 9 inches above 5000 feet, are possible. * WHERE...San Diego County Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM today. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Monday afternoon through late Monday night. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibilities at times. Significant reductions in visibility are possible. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for wet snow means periods of wet snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California. A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
